messages.message: Hello Team, Could you please take a look at this UI behavior while filtering the jobs via tag. The actual value of tag is this `AAMkAGM1ZDE3YTlmLTU2NTctNDcxNC1hODZjLTU3NTI5YTc5NmUwMQBGAAAAAABgSKLrAIjYQp10iuUJEZ9CBwA1XY1Hj8fCTYSp_3_kpICCAAAAAAEMAAA1XY1Hj8fCTYSp_3_kpICCAAIYveA-AAA=`  and I have verified it locally and it filters. Here in axa-uk.prod env, it just does not filter, irrespective of the correct response we get from the server. mov file and HAR will show that. We checked the console and there was no error there(strangely). So the jobs got back from server, but could not render
What is that value? Why would there be a tag like that?
That I guess is email id....I had the same question
my immediate thought on this is to use a much shorter tag and/or see if it’s a case-sensitive issue. Does it filter correctly with more readable tag names?

@Travis it’s a graph id, a unique identifier for each email received, this id cannot be changed as AXA or we don’t have any control on it. It does filter correctly these tag names as well, but this was an exception case AXA reported.
Can we do partial tag search? Or otherwise I wonder if the = char messes with it (or other underscores).
Ok but you’re saying otherwise it filters correctly. It’s this one tag that isn’t? Is it literally only this one?
We cannot do a partial search as there will be more results for it
Yeah I just meant partial and to omit the = sign or something.
This feels like a leetcode problem :)
Just to eliminate all that I tried doing the same tag locally on sbx and it works
Huh, wow. Ok that’s good to know. I wonder if there’s a case sensitivity issue. Perhaps try lower casing the whole tag and then enter it.
So there is one more thing I mentioned in the description....it gets the data from the server if you check the HAR
Ok I’ll have to check j it tomorrow.
